reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed her for three nights in July on the recomendation of a work mate who had sayed there previously.
reviews.title: Incredible location, value, Quality & Views. Don't stay anywhere else!

reviews.text: We had seen the photos, read the reviews on Trip Advisor and even considered other hotels but we kept coming back to this one so we booked it for three nights. Best Descision Ever!!!
reviews.title: Simply the best!

reviews.text: This is not a cheap nor expensive hotel. It sits in the middle range but lacks NOTHING!!
reviews.title: Magnifico!

reviews.text: The views are to die for. Hue Balcony straight off the room.
reviews.title: great location, fair price, excellet attention, highly recommended

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A word of warning, if you are not prepared to pay for an ocean facing room, dont stay here or anywhere else in Positano as you will not get the best out of this amazing place and would be better off going to another cheaper seaside town as this place is truly amazing when you wake up in the morning, walk out onto your terrace and then feel your jaw drop the second you walk out!
reviews.title: Love it and will definetely recommend it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What more could you want? Looks directly onto Positano's famous view, rooms are neat, clean and comfortable, every room has a balcony where breakfast is served and the staff were friendly and had excellent suggestions on local restaurants. Not to mention - location is walking distance from beach & key shops.
reviews.title: Loved it, highly recommend

reviews.text: Loved it and have told all my friends about it some of whom have stayed and loved it as well!
reviews.title: Wonderful stay

reviews.text: We highly recommend this hotel. We stayed in the two-bedroom suite with the sea-view terrace. The staff are wonderful. Massimo was so sweet. He carried our luggage and served breakfast on the terrace - always with a smile. Linda was warm and friendly. The facilities were spotless. The location is central and very convenient. Great value.
reviews.title: great place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed here and loved it. The place is like a B and B. Homey, relaxed and very well run. The view from our spacious deck was great--maybe our favorite spot in italy. The breakfast was simple but very well done (especially the hot chocolate!). The very best thing was the staff. They were friendly, and eager to help. They booked dinner reservations for us, excursion reservations, and were a great source of info on where to go and what to do. I would definitely go back.
reviews.title: our honeymoon

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: this was the perfect, romantic spot half-way up the hill... easy walk to the sea... unbelievable views from the private balconies... and breakfast served to your room every morning... quaint, clean rooms... beautiful, helpful staff... we will definitely be back!
reviews.title: Excellent View. Good Value. Dated Rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We went to the Amalfi Coast with another couple and stayed at Villa Rosa for 3 nights. We had a fabulous view from our large terrace, a large clean room and en suite bath. The staff was very helpful with dinner reservations, securing a rental car and motor bikes to tour the coast. There is no elevator or restaurant. The porter delivers everything to your room and complimentary room service on your terrace was heaven sent. Villa Rosa is located on the main road in Positano, but very quiet at night. It is a great location. I highly recommend renting motor bikes and driving down to Ravello and back. It was a great way to see the coast and be able to stop whenever and wherever you want!
reviews.title: Fabulous view and staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the Villa Rosa during our first trip to Italy. It was wonderful! It was a charming hotel at a reasonable rate. My favorite part of our stay was, of course, the view. I especially loved that the hotel staff delivered your breakfast to your room fresh each morning--for you to enjoy out on your balcony, taking in the beautiful scenery. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful. The rooms were quaint, clean, and comfortable. We will definitely return to the Villa Rosa.
reviews.title: The Perfect View at the perfect price!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Good value for the dollar. Great location. The balcony is incredible and the view even better. There were a few negatives (very small shower, beds a little hard, repetitive breakfasts) but the location and view outweighed any of this. Did I mention the great view from the balcony??
reviews.title: My memory of Positano will always be the balcony view from this hotel

reviews.text: We booked this hotel based on the experience of one of my best friends,,, and she was right! Lovely, awesome hotel with a magnificent view of Positano. We booked a quad/apartment for my husband and I and our two teenagers. They gave us two rooms each with bathroom. The service was excellent, and having the breakfast served in the room was a plus. Each room has a balcony and has a table and chairs,so you can have breakfast with the Med as the view... awesome.. like in the movies!! My only suggestion would be to add fresh fruits to the breakfast options,, the rest was magnificient. A very good locations close to the bus stop (3 minutes) to the Amalfi coast and few steps to town, (2 minutes) ; very accesible. I would love to return to Positano, and we will stay at Villa Rosa again.
reviews.title: We loved it! Want to go back.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Positano was the highlight of our trip. We stayed there 4 nights, though I wish we had stayed 5 to make the most of the various day trips from Positano. It was a convenient hub, and happy we stayed there rather than Sorrento, which isn't as nice. The food was amazing, Cafe Positano was recommended by the staff and it was great. It rained one day during out trip and we had a chance to meet other people staying there. The staff was super helpful, making reservations, helping us decide day trips and plan travel. Breakfast was good.
reviews.title: Friendly Staff, nice place

reviews.text: loved this place! we were supposed to stay somewhere else at the end of our trip but we decided to change plans and come back to this hotel the moment we hit the balcony. really fabulous views from most rooms (were in 4 different rooms!) - the village view rooms being the only exception (it was a bit more private as it was not as exposed), but you could still see the sea from one side. the reception staff were exceptional, linda in particular. the rooms appear to be recently renovated - everything looked freshly painted and the bathrooms were great. the breakfast is served in room on the terrace and a great way to start the day! the only downside was the stairs - stairs up from the street to get into the hotel and never ending stairs if you were staying in rooms higher than the first floor. otherwise, a perfect place!
reviews.title: Perfect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Villa Rosa is an old fashioned hotel in the best sense. The service is professional and courteous. The 2 old boys running the breakfast & restaurant are great. The hotel itself is all white inside. Decoration is classy rather than trendy or chic. The rooms are quite small, but clean and comfortable, and the views are fantastic. The hotel is in a great location. It’s easy to reach if you’re coming by bus from Sorrento (get off at Bar Internationale and it’s a 10 minute walk down the hill). There are lots of good quality restaurants on the road winding down into the town centre (but before you actually get into the centre). Breakfast was good. We ate in the restaurant one night - food, wine and service were all good, though eating out is probably a better choice with so many restaurants nearby. There is a town bus, but it really isn’t that far to walk down to the beach. And if you have the legs, then please do try the high footpath from Postinao to Praiano via Nocelle - the views are brilliant. Finally, Postinao is a great place to stay on Amalfi. Finally, my pet hate, PLEASE don't charge for wifi access.
reviews.title: Quality hotel with great views
Unique and outstanding views
reviews.text: Once you go here you will keep wanting to go back. That is what happened to me. The view from the balcony (you have to be on the top floor) are outstanding, location is wonderful, fresh scent of croissants filled with apricot jams and cappucinos are my favorites... If price is right, book it without a hesitation.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was a very nice hotel. It wasn't the fanciest place on earth, but it was clean and well kept. The people that work there are SO friendly and helpful. The breakfast delivered every morning at a time we designated to our private balcony overlooking Positano was amazing. We checked out a lot of hotels before booking this one, and we could have payed a lot more money, but this was just perfect for us. Its in a perfect location too. Has a fantastic view, and close enough to the bus stop. There's no elevator, but if stairs are an issue for you, then Positano will be tricky to begin with, as the entire town is vertical.
reviews.title: Nice place, clean, amazing view

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a bad experience with our travel agent and came upon Villa Rosa by accident. The staff was extremely understanding although our tensions were high. The breakfast on the balcony was a dream. The rooms were simple and charming, but the real bonus here was the balcony overlooking Positano. The only downside is the bathrooms which were functional only, but to be honest we were not in Positano for the bathrooms.
reviews.title: Amazing view!!!
